newsitem.title: USA: WASHINGTON POST FRONT BUSINESS PAGE - SEPT 7.
newsitem.headline: WASHINGTON POST FRONT BUSINESS PAGE - SEPT 7.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following items on the front page of its business section on Sept 7:
WASHINGTON - The U.S. unemployment rate dropped to a seven-year low of 5.1 percent in August.
WASHINGTON - Luskin's Inc., the Baltimore-based video and appliance retailer, will close eight of its 11 stores in the Washington area.
WASHINGTON - Signs of a price war are appearing in the auto industry as carmakers prepare for the start of the 1997 model year Oct. 1.
WASHINGTON - A federal judge in Philadelphia has temporarily ordered American Online Inc. to stop blocking electronic junk mail from Cyber Promotions Inc.
WASHINGTON - The Fox TV network is losing its top programming executive on the eve of the new TV season.
